title: Mum arrested after CCTV shows her 'deliberately abandoning her toddler daughter in supermarket'
text:

A mother has been arrested after intentionally abandoning her toddler daughter at a supermarket, police said. 
A manhunt was launched after the woman was caught on CCTV deliberately walking out of a grocery store in California without the two-year-old girl. 
Chiengkham Vilaysane was held on Tuesday evening following a public appeal for information. 
Riverside Police say they are "100 per cent" confident the 31-year-old is the child's mother. Read More Two toddlers discovered in 'cell-like' bedroom smeared with faeces were using grunts and "primal scream" noises to communicate Chiengkham Vilaysane was arrested following a manhunt (Photo: Riverside Police Dept.) 
Officers were called to the Food 4 Less store on Van Buren Blvd at around 6pm on Sunday after the little girl was found alone but unharmed. 
Surveillance footage from the store shows the woman paying for her groceries before walking out of the store without her daughter. CCTV showed the mum allegedly abandoning her daughter at the supermarket (Photo: Riverside Police Department) 
When a bystander tried to reunite the child with her mother after they became separated, Vilaysane allegedly said: "Oh, just leave her." 
Police released the footage on Monday and received a tip-off which helped them trace the mother by Tuesday morning. Read More Two adults arrested after five-year-old boy drowned at water park The 31-year-old allegedly told a bystander who tried to reunite her with her daughter to "just leave her" (Photo: Facebook) 
Officer Ryan Railsback said: "We are 100 percent confident that this girl is the one who was on the video." 
Vilaysane is being held at the Robert Presley Detention Center on suspicion of child neglect and willfully harming a child. Like us on Facebook
